bibl.note: In this letter, dated October 23, 1861 R.H. Hodsden in Nashville, Tenn. writes to O.P. Temple in Knoxville, Tenn., informing him of the plan to indict Temple, Colonel Trigg and Colonel J. Williams for treason. He mentions that Thornburg will be released.

div.p: I have just learned from Judge Briant, this morning that in addition to Brownlow -- Col Trigg, Col Jso Williams and yourself, are to be indeted in the federal court, here, this week for Treason. I have barely time to write this much
Judge Brian told me about it in confidence. Thornburg will be released to day.
